description: From Middle English avowen, from Old French avouer, from Latin advocare (“to call to, call upon, hence to call as a witness, defender, patron, or advocate”), from ad (“to”) + vocare (“to call”).  Doublet of advoke, avouch, and advocate. Not related to vow.

verbs.description: avow (third-person singular simple present avows, present participle avowing, simple past and past participle avowed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To declare openly and boldly, as something believed to be right; to own, acknowledge or confess frankly.
(transitive) To bind or devote by a vow.
(law) To acknowledge and justify, as an act done. See avowry.
